But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. And there's a global maxima which is the absolute ceiling of the channel.ğŸ¯. ğ—¡ğ—¼ ğ—¼ğ—»ğ—² ğ—¸ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ˜€ ğ˜ğ—µğ—² ğ—´ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®. ğ—¦ğ—¼ ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—»ğ—²ğ—²ğ—± ğ˜ğ—¼ ğ—ºğ—®ğ—¸ğ—² ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—·ğ˜‚ğ—±ğ—´ğ—²ğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜.Local maxima can be approximated by experiments and existing data. But no one knows the global maxima since it's non-deterministic.This is therefore the most important role of founders:1) identify channel with highest global maxima,2) unlock local maxima,3) climb the curve as fast as possible.ğŸ°. ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—®ğ—» ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜† ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—» ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—±ğ—¼ ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜†ğ˜ğ—µğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´.You think in "This thing is too hard". But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. And there's a global maxima which is the absolute ceiling of the channel.ğŸ¯. ğ—¡ğ—¼ ğ—¼ğ—»ğ—² ğ—¸ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ˜€ ğ˜ğ—µğ—² ğ—´ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®. ğ—¦ğ—¼ ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—»ğ—²ğ—²ğ—± ğ˜ğ—¼ ğ—ºğ—®ğ—¸ğ—² ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—·ğ˜‚ğ—±ğ—´ğ—²ğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜.Local maxima can be approximated by experiments and existing data. But no one knows the global maxima since it's non-deterministic.This is therefore the most important role of founders:1) identify channel with highest global maxima,2) unlock local maxima,3) climb the curve as fast as possible.ğŸ°. ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—®ğ—» ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜† ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—» ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—±ğ—¼ ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜†ğ˜ğ—µğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´.You think in "This thing is too hard". But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. The only acceptable case to multitask is when you hit global maxima, or youâ€™re identifying local maxima to all-in in one channel.ğŸ². ğ—›ğ—¶ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ˜ğ—µğ—² ğ˜€ğ—µğ—¼ğ—¿ğ˜ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—°ğ—¼ğ—ºğ—½ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜† ğ—°ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—¯ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—® ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—².You can borrow peopleâ€™s progress (their distance climbed) by hiring them.ğŸ³. ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ—¿ ğ—±ğ—¼ğ—ºğ—®ğ—¶ğ—» ğ—¸ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—±ğ—´ğ—² ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—´ğ—²ğ—»ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ˜„ğ—¶ğ˜€ğ—±ğ—¼ğ—º ğ—±ğ—²ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—²ğ˜€ ğ—µğ—¼ğ˜„ ğ—³ğ—®ğ˜€ğ˜ ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—¯ ğ—® ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—².Learning curve is universal but how fast we climb a curve is different. Itâ€™s a mix of practice and gift.ğŸ´. ğ—Ÿğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—² ğ—¼ğ—³ ğ—® ğ—°ğ—µğ—®ğ—»ğ—»ğ—²ğ—¹ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ˜‚ğ—»ğ—¶ğ˜ƒğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜€ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—¶ğ—» ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ ğ—°ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ—²ğ˜€, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ˜€ğ—¼ğ—ºğ—² ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—ºğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—² ğ—®ğ—±ğ˜ƒğ—®ğ—»ğ—°ğ—²ğ—±.Companies in different countries are climbing the same curve, but countries usually have their own specialised learning curve where theyâ€™re leading other markets for at least 3 years. See the US in semi conductor, China in live streaming commerce.ğŸµ. ğ—¡ğ—¼ğ˜ ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ ğ—±ğ—¶ğ˜€ğ˜ğ—®ğ—»ğ—°ğ—² ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—¯ğ—²ğ—± ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—² ğ—ºğ—²ğ—®ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ğ—³ğ˜‚ğ—¹.Not all channelâ€™s learning curve progress translate to commercial value, but climbing are equally difficult. So choose wisely which to climb.

You soon hit a local maxima which limits your output due to lack of knowledge. And there's a global maxima which is the absolute ceiling of the channel.ğŸ¯. ğ—¡ğ—¼ ğ—¼ğ—»ğ—² ğ—¸ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ˜€ ğ˜ğ—µğ—² ğ—´ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®. ğ—¦ğ—¼ ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—»ğ—²ğ—²ğ—± ğ˜ğ—¼ ğ—ºğ—®ğ—¸ğ—² ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—·ğ˜‚ğ—±ğ—´ğ—²ğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜.Local maxima can be approximated by experiments and existing data. But no one knows the global maxima since it's non-deterministic.This is therefore the most important role of founders:1) identify channel with highest global maxima,2) unlock local maxima,3) climb the curve as fast as possible.ğŸ°. ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—®ğ—» ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜† ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—» ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—±ğ—¼ ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜†ğ˜ğ—µğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´.You think in "This thing is too hard". But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. The only acceptable case to multitask is when you hit global maxima, or youâ€™re identifying local maxima to all-in in one channel.ğŸ². ğ—›ğ—¶ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ˜ğ—µğ—² ğ˜€ğ—µğ—¼ğ—¿ğ˜ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—°ğ—¼ğ—ºğ—½ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜† ğ—°ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—¯ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—® ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—².You can borrow peopleâ€™s progress (their distance climbed) by hiring them.ğŸ³. ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ—¿ ğ—±ğ—¼ğ—ºğ—®ğ—¶ğ—» ğ—¸ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—±ğ—´ğ—² ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—´ğ—²ğ—»ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ˜„ğ—¶ğ˜€ğ—±ğ—¼ğ—º ğ—±ğ—²ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—²ğ˜€ ğ—µğ—¼ğ˜„ ğ—³ğ—®ğ˜€ğ˜ ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—¯ ğ—® ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—².Learning curve is universal but how fast we climb a curve is different. Itâ€™s a mix of practice and gift.ğŸ´. ğ—Ÿğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—² ğ—¼ğ—³ ğ—® ğ—°ğ—µğ—®ğ—»ğ—»ğ—²ğ—¹ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ˜‚ğ—»ğ—¶ğ˜ƒğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜€ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—¶ğ—» ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ ğ—°ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ—²ğ˜€, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ˜€ğ—¼ğ—ºğ—² ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—ºğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—² ğ—®ğ—±ğ˜ƒğ—®ğ—»ğ—°ğ—²ğ—±.Companies in different countries are climbing the same curve, but countries usually have their own specialised learning curve where theyâ€™re leading other markets for at least 3 years. See the US in semi conductor, China in live streaming commerce.ğŸµ. ğ—¡ğ—¼ğ˜ ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ ğ—±ğ—¶ğ˜€ğ˜ğ—®ğ—»ğ—°ğ—² ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—¯ğ—²ğ—± ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—² ğ—ºğ—²ğ—®ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ğ—³ğ˜‚ğ—¹.Not all channelâ€™s learning curve progress translate to commercial value, but climbing are equally difficult. And there's a global maxima which is the absolute ceiling of the channel.ğŸ¯. ğ—¡ğ—¼ ğ—¼ğ—»ğ—² ğ—¸ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ˜€ ğ˜ğ—µğ—² ğ—´ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®. ğ—¦ğ—¼ ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—»ğ—²ğ—²ğ—± ğ˜ğ—¼ ğ—ºğ—®ğ—¸ğ—² ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—·ğ˜‚ğ—±ğ—´ğ—²ğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜.Local maxima can be approximated by experiments and existing data. But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. Planning a tech career pivot in 2025? Start with the right certification path.Whether you are aiming to be a Cloud Engineer or diving into the world of AI/ML, the certification you choose can make or break your entry into the field.This blueprint maps out the most relevant certification paths based on your target role, so you are not just collecting badges, you are building a strategic, hire-ready profile.Here is how it is structured:1. Cloud & Platform Engineers:Start with system and container fundamentals, followed by multi-cloud and orchestration certs to build scalable systems.2. DevOps & MLOps Engineers:Focus on pipelines, automation, containerization, and CI/CD certifications to become a deployment ninja.3. AI & ML Engineers:Begin with foundational theory, then explore specializations in deep learning, model deployment, and real-world ML toolkits.4. Data & Site reliability engineers:Go from data processing to orchestration, with SREs focusing more on observability, reliability, and production-grade systems.5. Cybersecurity & Network Engineers:Pathways include threat detection, infrastructure hardening, and secure architecture design, essentials for protecting modern tech stacks.Certifications not only validate your skills but also help structure your learning journey, especially if you are self-taught or career-switching.Thinking of switching paths or leveling up your role?Which track are you eyeing in 2025?ğŸ‘‰ Are you finding it difficult to land your next tech offer? Planning a tech career pivot in 2025? Start with the right certification path.Whether you are aiming to be a Cloud Engineer or diving into the world of AI/ML, the certification you choose can make or break your entry into the field.This blueprint maps out the most relevant certification paths based on your target role, so you are not just collecting badges, you are building a strategic, hire-ready profile.Here is how it is structured:1. Cloud & Platform Engineers:Start with system and container fundamentals, followed by multi-cloud and orchestration certs to build scalable systems.2. DevOps & MLOps Engineers:Focus on pipelines, automation, containerization, and CI/CD certifications to become a deployment ninja.3. AI & ML Engineers:Begin with foundational theory, then explore specializations in deep learning, model deployment, and real-world ML toolkits.4. Data & Site reliability engineers:Go from data processing to orchestration, with SREs focusing more on observability, reliability, and production-grade systems.5. Cybersecurity & Network Engineers:Pathways include threat detection, infrastructure hardening, and secure architecture design, essentials for protecting modern tech stacks.Certifications not only validate your skills but also help structure your learning journey, especially if you are self-taught or career-switching.Thinking of switching paths or leveling up your role?Which track are you eyeing in 2025?ğŸ‘‰ Are you finding it difficult to land your next tech offer? With no agency help (all done alone), we bootstrapped from $40k to $1M ARR in 100 days.Here's what I learned:ğŸ­. ğ—”ğ—¹ğ—¹ ğ˜ğ—µğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ğ˜€ ğ—¶ğ—» ğ˜€ğ˜ğ—®ğ—¿ğ˜ğ˜‚ğ—½ (ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—¶ğ—» ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—³ğ—²) ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—°ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—¯ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—® ğ—»ğ—¼ğ—»-ğ—±ğ—²ğ˜ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—ºğ—¶ğ—»ğ—¶ğ˜€ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—° ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—².All work you do in the highest level of abstraction (e.g. idea) to the lowest level (e.g. video editing), has a learning curve.ğŸ®. ğ—Ÿğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—² ğ—µğ—®ğ˜€ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—´ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.As you work, you climb up the learning curve. You soon hit a local maxima which limits your output due to lack of knowledge. And there's a global maxima which is the absolute ceiling of the channel.ğŸ¯. ğ—¡ğ—¼ ğ—¼ğ—»ğ—² ğ—¸ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ˜€ ğ˜ğ—µğ—² ğ—´ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®. ğ—¦ğ—¼ ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—»ğ—²ğ—²ğ—± ğ˜ğ—¼ ğ—ºğ—®ğ—¸ğ—² ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—·ğ˜‚ğ—±ğ—´ğ—²ğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜.Local maxima can be approximated by experiments and existing data. But no one knows the global maxima since it's non-deterministic.This is therefore the most important role of founders:1) identify channel with highest global maxima,2) unlock local maxima,3) climb the curve as fast as possible.ğŸ°. ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—®ğ—» ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜† ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—» ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—±ğ—¼ ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜†ğ˜ğ—µğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´.You think in "This thing is too hard". But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. Planning a tech career pivot in 2025? Start with the right certification path.Whether you are aiming to be a Cloud Engineer or diving into the world of AI/ML, the certification you choose can make or break your entry into the field.This blueprint maps out the most relevant certification paths based on your target role, so you are not just collecting badges, you are building a strategic, hire-ready profile.Here is how it is structured:1. Cloud & Platform Engineers:Start with system and container fundamentals, followed by multi-cloud and orchestration certs to build scalable systems.2. DevOps & MLOps Engineers:Focus on pipelines, automation, containerization, and CI/CD certifications to become a deployment ninja.3. AI & ML Engineers:Begin with foundational theory, then explore specializations in deep learning, model deployment, and real-world ML toolkits.4. Data & Site reliability engineers:Go from data processing to orchestration, with SREs focusing more on observability, reliability, and production-grade systems.5. Cybersecurity & Network Engineers:Pathways include threat detection, infrastructure hardening, and secure architecture design, essentials for protecting modern tech stacks.Certifications not only validate your skills but also help structure your learning journey, especially if you are self-taught or career-switching.Thinking of switching paths or leveling up your role?Which track are you eyeing in 2025?ğŸ‘‰ Are you finding it difficult to land your next tech offer? Planning a tech career pivot in 2025? Start with the right certification path.Whether you are aiming to be a Cloud Engineer or diving into the world of AI/ML, the certification you choose can make or break your entry into the field.This blueprint maps out the most relevant certification paths based on your target role, so you are not just collecting badges, you are building a strategic, hire-ready profile.Here is how it is structured:1. Cloud & Platform Engineers:Start with system and container fundamentals, followed by multi-cloud and orchestration certs to build scalable systems.2. DevOps & MLOps Engineers:Focus on pipelines, automation, containerization, and CI/CD certifications to become a deployment ninja.3. AI & ML Engineers:Begin with foundational theory, then explore specializations in deep learning, model deployment, and real-world ML toolkits.4. Data & Site reliability engineers:Go from data processing to orchestration, with SREs focusing more on observability, reliability, and production-grade systems.5. Cybersecurity & Network Engineers:Pathways include threat detection, infrastructure hardening, and secure architecture design, essentials for protecting modern tech stacks.Certifications not only validate your skills but also help structure your learning journey, especially if you are self-taught or career-switching.Thinking of switching paths or leveling up your role?Which track are you eyeing in 2025?ğŸ‘‰ Are you finding it difficult to land your next tech offer? You soon hit a local maxima which limits your output due to lack of knowledge. And there's a global maxima which is the absolute ceiling of the channel.ğŸ¯. ğ—¡ğ—¼ ğ—¼ğ—»ğ—² ğ—¸ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ˜€ ğ˜ğ—µğ—² ğ—´ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®. ğ—¦ğ—¼ ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—»ğ—²ğ—²ğ—± ğ˜ğ—¼ ğ—ºğ—®ğ—¸ğ—² ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—·ğ˜‚ğ—±ğ—´ğ—²ğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜.Local maxima can be approximated by experiments and existing data. But no one knows the global maxima since it's non-deterministic.This is therefore the most important role of founders:1) identify channel with highest global maxima,2) unlock local maxima,3) climb the curve as fast as possible.ğŸ°. ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—®ğ—» ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜† ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—» ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—±ğ—¼ ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜†ğ˜ğ—µğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´.You think in "This thing is too hard". But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. Planning a tech career pivot in 2025? Start with the right certification path.Whether you are aiming to be a Cloud Engineer or diving into the world of AI/ML, the certification you choose can make or break your entry into the field.This blueprint maps out the most relevant certification paths based on your target role, so you are not just collecting badges, you are building a strategic, hire-ready profile.Here is how it is structured:1. Cloud & Platform Engineers:Start with system and container fundamentals, followed by multi-cloud and orchestration certs to build scalable systems.2. DevOps & MLOps Engineers:Focus on pipelines, automation, containerization, and CI/CD certifications to become a deployment ninja.3. AI & ML Engineers:Begin with foundational theory, then explore specializations in deep learning, model deployment, and real-world ML toolkits.4. Data & Site reliability engineers:Go from data processing to orchestration, with SREs focusing more on observability, reliability, and production-grade systems.5. Cybersecurity & Network Engineers:Pathways include threat detection, infrastructure hardening, and secure architecture design, essentials for protecting modern tech stacks.Certifications not only validate your skills but also help structure your learning journey, especially if you are self-taught or career-switching.Thinking of switching paths or leveling up your role?Which track are you eyeing in 2025?ğŸ‘‰ Are you finding it difficult to land your next tech offer? You soon hit a local maxima which limits your output due to lack of knowledge. And there's a global maxima which is the absolute ceiling of the channel.ğŸ¯. ğ—¡ğ—¼ ğ—¼ğ—»ğ—² ğ—¸ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ˜€ ğ˜ğ—µğ—² ğ—´ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®. ğ—¦ğ—¼ ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—»ğ—²ğ—²ğ—± ğ˜ğ—¼ ğ—ºğ—®ğ—¸ğ—² ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—·ğ˜‚ğ—±ğ—´ğ—²ğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜.Local maxima can be approximated by experiments and existing data. But no one knows the global maxima since it's non-deterministic.This is therefore the most important role of founders:1) identify channel with highest global maxima,2) unlock local maxima,3) climb the curve as fast as possible.ğŸ°. ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—®ğ—» ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜† ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—» ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—±ğ—¼ ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜†ğ˜ğ—µğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´.You think in "This thing is too hard". But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. Planning a tech career pivot in 2025? Start with the right certification path.Whether you are aiming to be a Cloud Engineer or diving into the world of AI/ML, the certification you choose can make or break your entry into the field.This blueprint maps out the most relevant certification paths based on your target role, so you are not just collecting badges, you are building a strategic, hire-ready profile.Here is how it is structured:1. Cloud & Platform Engineers:Start with system and container fundamentals, followed by multi-cloud and orchestration certs to build scalable systems.2. DevOps & MLOps Engineers:Focus on pipelines, automation, containerization, and CI/CD certifications to become a deployment ninja.3. AI & ML Engineers:Begin with foundational theory, then explore specializations in deep learning, model deployment, and real-world ML toolkits.4. Data & Site reliability engineers:Go from data processing to orchestration, with SREs focusing more on observability, reliability, and production-grade systems.5. Cybersecurity & Network Engineers:Pathways include threat detection, infrastructure hardening, and secure architecture design, essentials for protecting modern tech stacks.Certifications not only validate your skills but also help structure your learning journey, especially if you are self-taught or career-switching.Thinking of switching paths or leveling up your role?Which track are you eyeing in 2025?ğŸ‘‰ Are you finding it difficult to land your next tech offer? Planning a tech career pivot in 2025? Start with the right certification path.Whether you are aiming to be a Cloud Engineer or diving into the world of AI/ML, the certification you choose can make or break your entry into the field.This blueprint maps out the most relevant certification paths based on your target role, so you are not just collecting badges, you are building a strategic, hire-ready profile.Here is how it is structured:1. Cloud & Platform Engineers:Start with system and container fundamentals, followed by multi-cloud and orchestration certs to build scalable systems.2. DevOps & MLOps Engineers:Focus on pipelines, automation, containerization, and CI/CD certifications to become a deployment ninja.3. AI & ML Engineers:Begin with foundational theory, then explore specializations in deep learning, model deployment, and real-world ML toolkits.4. Data & Site reliability engineers:Go from data processing to orchestration, with SREs focusing more on observability, reliability, and production-grade systems.5. Cybersecurity & Network Engineers:Pathways include threat detection, infrastructure hardening, and secure architecture design, essentials for protecting modern tech stacks.Certifications not only validate your skills but also help structure your learning journey, especially if you are self-taught or career-switching.Thinking of switching paths or leveling up your role?Which track are you eyeing in 2025?ğŸ‘‰ Are you finding it difficult to land your next tech offer? But no one knows the global maxima since it's non-deterministic.This is therefore the most important role of founders:1) identify channel with highest global maxima,2) unlock local maxima,3) climb the curve as fast as possible.ğŸ°. ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—®ğ—» ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜† ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—» ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—±ğ—¼ ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜†ğ˜ğ—µğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´.You think in "This thing is too hard". The only acceptable case to multitask is when you hit global maxima, or youâ€™re identifying local maxima to all-in in one channel.ğŸ². ğ—›ğ—¶ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ˜ğ—µğ—² ğ˜€ğ—µğ—¼ğ—¿ğ˜ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—°ğ—¼ğ—ºğ—½ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜† ğ—°ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—¯ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—® ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—².You can borrow peopleâ€™s progress (their distance climbed) by hiring them.ğŸ³. ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ—¿ ğ—±ğ—¼ğ—ºğ—®ğ—¶ğ—» ğ—¸ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—±ğ—´ğ—² ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—´ğ—²ğ—»ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ˜„ğ—¶ğ˜€ğ—±ğ—¼ğ—º ğ—±ğ—²ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—²ğ˜€ ğ—µğ—¼ğ˜„ ğ—³ğ—®ğ˜€ğ˜ ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—¯ ğ—® ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—².Learning curve is universal but how fast we climb a curve is different. Itâ€™s a mix of practice and gift.ğŸ´. ğ—Ÿğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—² ğ—¼ğ—³ ğ—® ğ—°ğ—µğ—®ğ—»ğ—»ğ—²ğ—¹ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ˜‚ğ—»ğ—¶ğ˜ƒğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜€ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—¶ğ—» ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ ğ—°ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ—²ğ˜€, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ˜€ğ—¼ğ—ºğ—² ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—ºğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—² ğ—®ğ—±ğ˜ƒğ—®ğ—»ğ—°ğ—²ğ—±.Companies in different countries are climbing the same curve, but countries usually have their own specialised learning curve where theyâ€™re leading other markets for at least 3 years. See the US in semi conductor, China in live streaming commerce.ğŸµ. ğ—¡ğ—¼ğ˜ ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ ğ—±ğ—¶ğ˜€ğ˜ğ—®ğ—»ğ—°ğ—² ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—¯ğ—²ğ—± ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—² ğ—ºğ—²ğ—®ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ğ—³ğ˜‚ğ—¹.Not all channelâ€™s learning curve progress translate to commercial value, but climbing are equally difficult. Planning a tech career pivot in 2025? Start with the right certification path.Whether you are aiming to be a Cloud Engineer or diving into the world of AI/ML, the certification you choose can make or break your entry into the field.This blueprint maps out the most relevant certification paths based on your target role, so you are not just collecting badges, you are building a strategic, hire-ready profile.Here is how it is structured:1. Cloud & Platform Engineers:Start with system and container fundamentals, followed by multi-cloud and orchestration certs to build scalable systems.2. DevOps & MLOps Engineers:Focus on pipelines, automation, containerization, and CI/CD certifications to become a deployment ninja.3. AI & ML Engineers:Begin with foundational theory, then explore specializations in deep learning, model deployment, and real-world ML toolkits.4. Data & Site reliability engineers:Go from data processing to orchestration, with SREs focusing more on observability, reliability, and production-grade systems.5. Cybersecurity & Network Engineers:Pathways include threat detection, infrastructure hardening, and secure architecture design, essentials for protecting modern tech stacks.Certifications not only validate your skills but also help structure your learning journey, especially if you are self-taught or career-switching.Thinking of switching paths or leveling up your role?Which track are you eyeing in 2025?ğŸ‘‰ Are you finding it difficult to land your next tech offer? And there's a global maxima which is the absolute ceiling of the channel.ğŸ¯. ğ—¡ğ—¼ ğ—¼ğ—»ğ—² ğ—¸ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ˜€ ğ˜ğ—µğ—² ğ—´ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®. ğ—¦ğ—¼ ğ˜†ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—»ğ—²ğ—²ğ—± ğ˜ğ—¼ ğ—ºğ—®ğ—¸ğ—² ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—·ğ˜‚ğ—±ğ—´ğ—²ğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜.Local maxima can be approximated by experiments and existing data. But no one knows the global maxima since it's non-deterministic.This is therefore the most important role of founders:1) identify channel with highest global maxima,2) unlock local maxima,3) climb the curve as fast as possible.ğŸ°. ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—°ğ—®ğ—» ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜† ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—» ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—±ğ—¼ ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜†ğ˜ğ—µğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´.You think in "This thing is too hard". But if you think in learning curve, youâ€™re not very far away from that cracked engineer friend you know.ğŸ±. ğ— ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¶-ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—±, ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¶ğ˜'ğ˜€ ğ—´ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—³ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ºğ—®ğ˜…ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—®.You climb the curve by working.The unit to produce work is either time or money (to buy other peopleâ€™s time).By multi-tasking you spread your finite resources (time) across different channels, which slow down compounding. Planning a tech career pivot in 2025? Start with the right certification path.Whether you are aiming to be a Cloud Engineer or diving into the world of AI/ML, the certification you choose can make or break your entry into the field.This blueprint maps out the most relevant certification paths based on your target role, so you are not just collecting badges, you are building a strategic, hire-ready profile.Here is how it is structured:1. Cloud & Platform Engineers:Start with system and container fundamentals, followed by multi-cloud and orchestration certs to build scalable systems.2. DevOps & MLOps Engineers:Focus on pipelines, automation, containerization, and CI/CD certifications to become a deployment ninja.3. AI & ML Engineers:Begin with foundational theory, then explore specializations in deep learning, model deployment, and real-world ML toolkits.4. Data & Site reliability engineers:Go from data processing to orchestration, with SREs focusing more on observability, reliability, and production-grade systems.5. Cybersecurity & Network Engineers:Pathways include threat detection, infrastructure hardening, and secure architecture design, essentials for protecting modern tech stacks.Certifications not only validate your skills but also help structure your learning journey, especially if you are self-taught or career-switching.Thinking of switching paths or leveling up your role?Which track are you eyeing in 2025?ğŸ‘‰ Are you finding it difficult to land your next tech offer?
